page.title: 16CHURCH HERITAGE
page.content: The area contains 4 ancient churches (St. Martin of Tours,Guston; St. Peter's,West Cliffe;St. Augustine,E. Langdon and St Margaret of Antioch,St. Margaret's). They were all built at about the same time in the middle or late 12th century,built largely of flint and rubble. The original interiors with early glass and rood screens were destroyed in the Mid Tudor times. In the early Georgian period the interiors were simplified and box pews added. The latter remain at West Cliffe. Major renovations took place in the Victorian times. Medieval style were rebuilt and a tower was added at E.Langdon. Today only St Margaret's is impressive,possessing a grand Norman west aechway. The churches possess some fine Georgian plate and thee is a 15th century cope at E.Lagdon.
